CatDescriptText: Miss Marjorie Robinson, 2533 Magnet, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?"  Answer reads: "There is no Negro leadership where I live which is around Perrysville Ave.  In other sections of the city, I would say that Negro leaders are doing a good job.  And from what I have heard, the NAACP seems to be doing a good job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marjorie Robinson wearing leather jacket and standing on sidewalk in front of building with display case
